intro: Glochidion philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland and montane forests. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Glochidion philippinense is also noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
